Rulings.Tengu:
●Contract with the Abyss is used as a generic substitute for Ritual Spell Cards like Black Illusion Ritual and Contract with the Dark Master. You cannot use Contract with the Abyss to Ritual Summon a non-Ritual Monster like Dark Magician.
●Cost Down will not reduce the number of Level Stars needed to perform a Ritual Summon, even if used with Contract with the Abyss.
●If you Ritual Summon a Ritual Monster using Contract with the Abyss, it is considered properly Summoned, so you can use Monster Reborn on it afterwards.
Rulings.Goat:
●Contract with the Abyss is used as a generic substitute for Ritual Spell Cards like Black Illusion Ritual and Contract with the Dark Master. You cannot use Contract with the Abyss to Ritual Summon a non-Ritual Monster like Dark Magician.
●Cost Down will not reduce the number of Lv Stars needed to perform a Ritual Summon, even if used with Contract with the Abyss.
●If you Ritual Summon a Ritual Monster using Contract with the Abyss, it is considered properly Summoned, so you can use Monster Reborn on it afterwards.
●Q: Does “Contract with the Abyss” only work on Ritual Monsters or can it Summon any DARK monster asthe card states? 
A: The card states “Ritual Summon any DARK monster.” You cannot Ritual Summon a non-Ritual monster.  12/29/2003 
●Q: May I use “Contract with the Abyss,” to ritual summon “Relinquished?” 
A: Yes you may. You will need to offer monsters that total level stars equal to 1, as stated on “Relinquished.” “Contract with the Abyss” may be used to Ritual Summon any DARK attribute Ritual monster including: “Dark Master Zorc,” “Relinquished,” “The Masked Beast,” and “Hungry Burger.” 
●Q: “Contract with the Abyss” states in its text that the Lv Stars of the monsters being offered as a Tribute equal that of the Ritual Monster being Ritual Summoned. Can the total of Lv Stars being offered be higher than the Ritual Monster or must it be exactly equal? 
A: The total Lv Stars of the monster(s) offered as a Tribute for the Ritual Summon using Contract with the Abyss must equal the Lv Stars of the DARK Ritual Monster you are attempting to Ritual Summon. You cannot go above the Lv Stars of the DARK Ritual Monster. So if I want to Ritual Summon Dark Master - Zorc using Contract with Abyss, I must offer monsters whose total Lv Stars = 8. I cannot go above 8. I could offer two 4-Lv Star monsters and the total would equal 8. I could offer four 2-Lv Star monsters, because they would equal 8. I would not be able to offer a 5-Lv Star and a 4-Lv Star monster because their total Lv Stars would equal 9.

Rulings.Base: 1. "Contract with the Abyss" is used as a generic substitute for Ritual Spell Cards like "Black Illusion Ritual" and "Contract with the Dark Master". You cannot use "Contract with the Abyss" to Ritual Summon a non-Ritual Monster like "Dark Magician".\n2. "Cost Down" will not reduce the number of Level Stars needed to perform a Ritual Summon, even if used with "Contract with the Abyss".\n3. If you Ritual Summon a Ritual Monster using "Contract with the Abyss", it is considered properly Summoned, so you can use "Monster Reborn" on it afterwards.
